Through original programming, documentaries, and expert-led discussions, MHTN aims to increase awareness, provide valuable information, and encourage open conversations about mental well-being.

programme.title: Quo Vadis TV
programme.desc: Quo Vadis TV is committed to sharing the Biblical message in a way that makes Christian living practical, realistic, and attainable. Our theme is summarized the question: "where are you going?" Our Aim with this inquiry is to help people find orientation and find the path back to God.

programme.title: It Is Written
programme.desc: "It Is Written" has been a staple on American television since premiering in 1956. The weekly program, currently hosted by John Bradshaw, applies timeless truths to everyday life, with many episodes dealing with issues such as loneliness, fear, low self-esteem and spiritual principles. With its straightforward, uplifting presentations, the program aims to inspire and encourage people of all faiths and creeds. Founded by George Vandeman, "It Is Written" was the first religious telecast to air in color.

programme.title: It Is Written
programme.desc: "It Is Written" has been a staple on American television since premiering in 1956. The weekly program, currently hosted by John Bradshaw, applies timeless truths to everyday life, with many episodes dealing with issues such as loneliness, fear, low self-esteem and spiritual principles. With its straightforward, uplifting presentations, the program aims to inspire and encourage people of all faiths and creeds. Founded by George Vandeman, "It Is Written" was the first religious telecast to air in color.

programme.title: Catch 21

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: The $100,000 Pyramid
programme.desc: Two teams of two compete in a word-association game. Each contestant gets a celebrity partner, and one partner provides clues to the other about six mystery words, leaving the other to guess those words before the time runs out. The team with the most points gets to play in the winners circle, where the top prize is $100,000. Michael Strahan hosts.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
programme.desc: Contestants answer increasingly difficult multiple-choice questions to win cash - up to $1 million, or even more in certain episodes. Along the way, contestants have "lifelines" they can use to help them answer the questions, including asking the studio audience for help.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash from one penny to $1 million. The player then eliminates the remaining 25 cases one by one. The chosen ones are opened and the amount of money inside revealed. After several cases are opened, the player is tempted by the Banker to accept an offer of cash in exchange for not continuing the game and possibly winning a larger sum of money.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show - with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot - as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek is the current host; he began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run).

programme.title: Master Minds
programme.desc: Three challengers take on some of the great minds in trivia in a showdown of smarts and strategy; the last contestant standing will face off against the highest scoring Master Mind in a head-to-head battle.

programme.title: America Says
programme.desc: Game show series have been making a comeback in television, and media and "America Says" is no exception. This program is following in the footsteps of the popular mobile app game "HQ Trivia." The network is planning its own spin on the game show, and Fran Shea, evp, programming and marketing, says she "has been studying the GSN audience and prepared a slate of new shows that reflect what it wants: family-friendly, fun, escapist television." In "America Says," two teams face off to guess Americans' responses to questions covering a variety of topics. Michael Higgins is the host.

programme.title: Chain Reaction
programme.desc: This incarnation of the word-association game show that dates back, in various forms, to the early '80s is hosted by radio personality Mike Catherwood ("Loveline"). The premise is simple: two teams try to complete chains of seven words. The first and last word in each chain are revealed, and the contestants must guess the missing words, with one letter being revealed each turn. Each link in the chain forms a compound word or phrase with the word before and/or after it. Teams earn money for each word they guess correctly, and the team with the most money at the end of the game goes on to the bonus round, dubbed the Super Chain, for a chance to add an additional $5,000 to the total the team won during the main part of the game.

programme.title: Beat the Bridge
programme.desc: An interactive bridge dares players to cross by stepping on the right answers to challenging trivia questions; each step forward puts money in the team's bank, with bonus money for each successful crossing.

programme.title: The Wall
programme.desc: Everyday people battle a variety of trivia questions and a 40-foot wall for a chance to win millions of dollars. Each pair of deserving contestants, from siblings to spouses to best friends, has a plan to use the life-changing winnings for good things. But defeating the wall is no easy feat. Executive Producer LeBron James' game is a true test of both knowledge and poise. With momentary changes between fortune and failure, the outcome is as unpredictable as the bounce of the ball.

The network is planning its own spin on the game show, and Fran Shea, evp, programming and marketing, says she "has been studying the GSN audience and prepared a slate of new shows that reflect what it wants: family-friendly, fun, escapist television." In "America Says," two teams face off to guess Americans' responses to questions covering a variety of topics. Michael Higgins is the host.

programme.title: America Says
programme.desc: Game show series have been making a comeback in television, and media and "America Says" is no exception. This program is following in the footsteps of the popular mobile app game "HQ Trivia." The network is planning its own spin on the game show, and Fran Shea, evp, programming and marketing, says she "has been studying the GSN audience and prepared a slate of new shows that reflect what it wants: family-friendly, fun, escapist television." In "America Says," two teams face off to guess Americans' responses to questions covering a variety of topics. Michael Higgins is the host.

programme.title: Switch
programme.desc: Jeff Hephner challenges contestants who are ranked based on their answers to trivia questions for a chance at $10,000; every question counts, as each answer can propel them to the top or to the bottom, where they'll be in jeopardy of elimination.

programme.title: Split Second
programme.desc: John Michael Higgins presents three contestants with a question and three possible choices and whoever buzzes in fastest earns the right to answer first.

programme.title: Flip Side
programme.desc: The hilarious new survey game show explores answers to questions from differing perspectives; host Jaleel White.

programme.title: Chain Reaction
programme.desc: This incarnation of the word-association game show that dates back, in various forms, to the early '80s is hosted by radio personality Mike Catherwood ("Loveline"). The premise is simple: two teams try to complete chains of seven words. The first and last word in each chain are revealed, and the contestants must guess the missing words, with one letter being revealed each turn. Each link in the chain forms a compound word or phrase with the word before and/or after it. Teams earn money for each word they guess correctly, and the team with the most money at the end of the game goes on to the bonus round, dubbed the Super Chain, for a chance to add an additional $5,000 to the total the team won during the main part of the game.

programme.title: Beat the Bridge
programme.desc: An interactive bridge dares players to cross by stepping on the right answers to challenging trivia questions; each step forward puts money in the team's bank, with bonus money for each successful crossing.

programme.title: Beat the Bridge
programme.desc: An interactive bridge dares players to cross by stepping on the right answers to challenging trivia questions; each step forward puts money in the team's bank, with bonus money for each successful crossing.

programme.title: Switch
programme.desc: Jeff Hephner challenges contestants who are ranked based on their answers to trivia questions for a chance at $10,000; every question counts, as each answer can propel them to the top or to the bottom, where they'll be in jeopardy of elimination.

programme.title: Split Second
programme.desc: John Michael Higgins presents three contestants with a question and three possible choices and whoever buzzes in fastest earns the right to answer first.

programme.title: The Wall
programme.desc: Everyday people battle a variety of trivia questions and a 40-foot wall for a chance to win millions of dollars. Each pair of deserving contestants, from siblings to spouses to best friends, has a plan to use the life-changing winnings for good things. But defeating the wall is no easy feat. Executive Producer LeBron James' game is a true test of both knowledge and poise. With momentary changes between fortune and failure, the outcome is as unpredictable as the bounce of the ball.

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show - with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot - as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek is the current host; he began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run).

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Flip Side
programme.desc: The hilarious new survey game show explores answers to questions from differing perspectives; host Jaleel White.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune

programme.title: People Puzzler
programme.desc: Leah Remini hosts the show, which features three contestants who put their pop culture knowledge to the test to complete crosswords from the pop culture magazine. During a player's turn, one word out of 10 is chosen from the board. The contestant is then shown the first unrevealed letter in the word, and a clue is given, with correct answers scoring points based on the word. The player who wins the most points after three rounds moves forward to the fast puzzle bonus round, where they get the opportunity to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Catch 21

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: Cash Cab

programme.title: The $100,000 Pyramid
programme.desc: Two teams of two compete in a word-association game. Each contestant gets a celebrity partner, and one partner provides clues to the other about six mystery words, leaving the other to guess those words before the time runs out. The team with the most points gets to play in the winners circle, where the top prize is $100,000. Michael Strahan hosts.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
programme.desc: Contestants answer increasingly difficult multiple-choice questions to win cash - up to $1 million, or even more in certain episodes. Along the way, contestants have "lifelines" they can use to help them answer the questions, including asking the studio audience for help.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash from one penny to $1 million. The player then eliminates the remaining 25 cases one by one. The chosen ones are opened and the amount of money inside revealed. After several cases are opened, the player is tempted by the Banker to accept an offer of cash in exchange for not continuing the game and possibly winning a larger sum of money.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
programme.desc: Contestants answer increasingly difficult multiple-choice questions to win cash - up to $1 million, or even more in certain episodes. Along the way, contestants have "lifelines" they can use to help them answer the questions, including asking the studio audience for help.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash from one penny to $1 million. The player then eliminates the remaining 25 cases one by one. The chosen ones are opened and the amount of money inside revealed. After several cases are opened, the player is tempted by the Banker to accept an offer of cash in exchange for not continuing the game and possibly winning a larger sum of money.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show - with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot - as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek is the current host; he began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run).

programme.title: Master Minds
programme.desc: Three challengers take on some of the great minds in trivia in a showdown of smarts and strategy; the last contestant standing will face off against the highest scoring Master Mind in a head-to-head battle.

programme.title: America Says
programme.desc: Game show series have been making a comeback in television, and media and "America Says" is no exception. This program is following in the footsteps of the popular mobile app game "HQ Trivia." The network is planning its own spin on the game show, and Fran Shea, evp, programming and marketing, says she "has been studying the GSN audience and prepared a slate of new shows that reflect what it wants: family-friendly, fun, escapist television." In "America Says," two teams face off to guess Americans' responses to questions covering a variety of topics. Michael Higgins is the host.

programme.title: America Says
programme.desc: Game show series have been making a comeback in television, and media and "America Says" is no exception. This program is following in the footsteps of the popular mobile app game "HQ Trivia." In "America Says," two teams face off to guess Americans' responses to questions covering a variety of topics. Michael Higgins is the host.

programme.title: Switch
programme.desc: Jeff Hephner challenges contestants who are ranked based on their answers to trivia questions for a chance at $10,000; every question counts, as each answer can propel them to the top or to the bottom, where they'll be in jeopardy of elimination.

programme.title: Split Second
programme.desc: John Michael Higgins presents three contestants with a question and three possible choices and whoever buzzes in fastest earns the right to answer first.

programme.title: Flip Side
programme.desc: The hilarious new survey game show explores answers to questions from differing perspectives; host Jaleel White.

programme.title: Chain Reaction
programme.desc: This incarnation of the word-association game show that dates back, in various forms, to the early '80s is hosted by radio personality Mike Catherwood ("Loveline"). The premise is simple: two teams try to complete chains of seven words. The first and last word in each chain are revealed, and the contestants must guess the missing words, with one letter being revealed each turn. Each link in the chain forms a compound word or phrase with the word before and/or after it. Teams earn money for each word they guess correctly, and the team with the most money at the end of the game goes on to the bonus round, dubbed the Super Chain, for a chance to add an additional $5,000 to the total the team won during the main part of the game.

programme.title: Beat the Bridge
programme.desc: An interactive bridge dares players to cross by stepping on the right answers to challenging trivia questions; each step forward puts money in the team's bank, with bonus money for each successful crossing.

programme.title: The Wall
programme.desc: Everyday people battle a variety of trivia questions and a 40-foot wall for a chance to win millions of dollars. Each pair of deserving contestants, from siblings to spouses to best friends, has a plan to use the life-changing winnings for good things. But defeating the wall is no easy feat. Executive Producer LeBron James' game is a true test of both knowledge and poise. With momentary changes between fortune and failure, the outcome is as unpredictable as the bounce of the ball.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: People Puzzler
programme.desc: Leah Remini hosts the show, which features three contestants who put their pop culture knowledge to the test to complete crosswords from the pop culture magazine. During a player's turn, one word out of 10 is chosen from the board. The contestant is then shown the first unrevealed letter in the word, and a clue is given, with correct answers scoring points based on the word. The player who wins the most points after three rounds moves forward to the fast puzzle bonus round, where they get the opportunity to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Paid Programming
programme.desc: Paid programming.

programme.title: Match Game
programme.desc: Gene Rayburn hosts this comedy-game show hybrid in which contestants try to match answers given by celebrities to humorous, and often risque, fill-in-the-blank questions. The contestant with the most points at the end of the game advances to play the bonus round, in which the contestant has a chance to win thousands of dollars, with the actual amount dependent on the rules in place at the time of the episode.

programme.title: Chain Reaction
programme.desc: Two teams of three compete to complete a chain of words after the first and last words in the chain are revealed. The team that completes the most chains wins and advances to a bonus round to determine the amount of money won. Dylan Lane hosts.

programme.title: Chain Reaction
programme.desc: Two teams of three compete to complete a chain of words after the first and last words in the chain are revealed. The team that completes the most chains wins and advances to a bonus round to determine the amount of money won. Dylan Lane hosts.

programme.title: Catch 21
programme.desc: Players must combine their trivia talent with card-counting skills to win at "Catch 21." Alfonso Ribiero hosts.

programme.title: Catch 21
programme.desc: Players must combine their trivia talent with card-counting skills to win at "Catch 21." Alfonso Ribiero hosts.

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: Cash Cab

A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: The $100,000 Pyramid
programme.desc: Two teams of two compete in a word-association game. Each contestant gets a celebrity partner, and one partner provides clues to the other about six mystery words, leaving the other to guess those words before the time runs out. The team with the most points gets to play in the winners circle, where the top prize is $100,000. Michael Strahan hosts.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
programme.desc: Contestants answer increasingly difficult multiple-choice questions to win cash - up to $1 million, or even more in certain episodes. Along the way, contestants have "lifelines" they can use to help them answer the questions, including asking the studio audience for help.

programme.title: High Lonesome
programme.desc: A sudden and swift series of murders occurs in southwestern Texas, sending Big Bend country into a frenzy. All parties are suspicious of a young rambler who just moved to the area, believing his presence must be related to the crimes.

programme.title: McLintock!
programme.desc: A cattle baron awaits the return of his daughter from school and is surprised that his wife has returned to take their daughter away. He tries to keep the peace and do what is best for everyone.

programme.title: The Proud Rebel
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran battles prejudice and greed as he helps a woman save her ranch from a land grab, while searching for a cure for his mute son.

programme.title: The Deadly Companions
programme.desc: When a former Army officer accidentally kills a woman's young son, he offers to escort the grieving mother through dangerous Indian territory on the way to lay the boy to rest at the family homestead.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E2 Ghosts Rachel is troubled by a tragic incident from the past. The riders help clear her name after she was wrongfully charged with murder. Teaspoon finally finds out Lou's secret, but still allows her to continue as a rider.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E7 Molly's Choice A young Jim Bridger helps a Shoshone woman escape the clutches of her abusive husband. As Bridger squares off against the frontier ruffian and his henchmen, he soon realizes that the woman he is helping is none other than the legendary Sacajawea.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Snakeroot Cure When a young girl is bitten by a rattlesnake, mountain man Jim Bridger finds himself in a race against time to save her arm and keep her alive as he desperately searches the wilderness for a medicinal plant that once saved the life of his friend.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E1 Bat Masterson to the Rescue Now without a badge, former lawman Bat Masterson finds himself powerless to help an old friend whose brother has been falsely imprisoned. An overreaching sheriff is intent on seeing the brother hang, so Bat hatches a plan to bust him out of jail.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S3 E11 Al Jennings and the Legend of Dick West Tired of his boring life, attorney Al Jennings dreams of the adventures he reads in dime novels. After a chance encounter with Dick West, Jennings joins the outlaw's gang and learns that a life of crime isn't as glamorous as he thought it would be.

programme.title: Buffalo Keepers
programme.desc: S1 E1 Today, the buffalo is the quintessential symbol of strength, freedom, and the unspoiled American West. But in the late 1800s, the nation's buffalo were nearly wiped out by ruthless hide hunters. Those majestic herds, which once numbered in the tens of millions, were down to less than 500 animals. This is the story of the handful of determined men and women who mobilized to save the ones that were left in a last-ditch effort to stave off extinction. Ranchers like Charles and Mary Ann Goodnight rescued orphaned buffalo calves and built small herds. Former buffalo hunters like Buffalo Bill helped build public sympathy. And politicians like Theodore Roosevelt helped pass laws to protect the remaining animals. The effort would be a generational one, with buffalo herds carefully tended, bred, and passed down to new stewards when their old protectors passed away. Thanks to their efforts, there are an estimated 500,000 buffalo thundering across America's grasslands once again.

programme.title: High Lonesome
programme.desc: A sudden and swift series of murders occurs in southwestern Texas, sending Big Bend country into a frenzy. All parties are suspicious of a young rambler who just moved to the area, believing his presence must be related to the crimes.

programme.title: McLintock!
programme.desc: A cattle baron awaits the return of his daughter from school and is surprised that his wife has returned to take their daughter away. He tries to keep the peace and do what is best for everyone.

programme.title: The Proud Rebel
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran battles prejudice and greed as he helps a woman save her ranch from a land grab, while searching for a cure for his mute son.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E16 Daddy's Girl There is a new girl in Sweetwater, and she has eyes for Buck. However, Buck must contend with her rich, oppressive father. Meanwhile, the riders help a woman in need after the corrupt banker's henchmen kill her husband.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E17 Bulldog College student, Ambrose Bulldog Merriweather, comes to Sweetwater. He wants to meet his Western idol, Jimmy Hickok. However, unbeknownst to him, the Pony Express ownership's plans could get him into trouble and put all of the riders in danger.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Sharpshooter Lucas McCain and his son, Mark, arrive in North Fork to purchase a ranch. When Lucas enters a turkey shoot to win money for a down payment, he soon finds himself at odds with town villain Jim Lewis.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E2 Home Ranch After Lucas buys his ranch, hired hands of a wealthy cattleman demand he leave. When Lucas refuses, the men beat him, drag him, and then they burn his ranch house to the ground. Lucas tracks these men down and confronts their boss, Oat Jackford.

programme.title: They Call Me Trinity
programme.desc: When a land-hungry rancher sends his bullies to harass peace-loving Mormons into giving up their fertile valley, a lazy gunfighter with a very quick draw and amazing accuracy, along with his horse-thieving brother, come to the settlers' rescue.

programme.title: County Line
programme.desc: When his best friend, Sheriff Clint Thorne (Jeff Fahey, Texas Rising, Justified), is brutally gunned down, former neighboring county sheriff, Alden Rockwell (Tom Wopat, The Dukes Of Hazzard, Longmire) is left with many questions and no answers. After the investigation stalls and his replacement, Sheriff Preston (Grant Goodeve, Eight is Enough, Dynasty) turns a blind eye, Alden takes the case into his own hands. Uncovering a web of crime, deceit, and corruption that spreads through two counties, Alden is caught in a deadly criminal network with no backup, no badge, and local diner owner, Maddie (Patricia Richardson, Home Improvement, The West Wing) as his only ally. Seeking justice at any cost, Alden must find out who's behind this criminal enterprise, even if some lines must be crossed.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Bandit Queen Once a feared gunfighter and sheriff, the legendary Bat Masterson is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the real story of Pearl Hart, the first woman to rob a stagecoach in the Old West. Masterson tracks down Pearl’s partner-in-crime, Joe Boot, who shares every daring and surprising detail from his wild days with the notorious “Bandit Queen.” In a time when outlaws and gunslingers captured the fascination of the American public, Pearl Hart was living proof that in the Wild West a woman could be just as infamous as a man.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Dalton Gang Bat Masterson, legendary gunfighter and sheriff, is now working as a newspaperman. He heads west again to uncover the real story behind the most brazen bank robbery of the Old West. Masterson tracks down the sole survivor of the Dalton Gang, who relives the horrible day when they attempted to rob two banks at the same time. The youngest of the Dalton brothers, Emmett Dalton describes how the gang was gunned down as they tried to make their getaway. Despite numerous gunshot wounds, Emmett lived to serve his time in prison and renounce his life of crime.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E17 Long Trek While escorting a killer named Stanley to North Fork to stand trial, Lucas and Marshal Micah Torrance endure harsh conditions crossing the desert. Micah is injured and their horses are lost. The prisoner taunts them but Lucas' endurance prevails.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E18 The Actress A dying friend of Lucas McCain's asks him to go to a nearby town to bring back his wife, Elizabeth, so he can see her one last time. Lucas agrees but is surprised to find a beautiful, young actress who is not interested in grieving over her husband.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E19 Face of Yesterday Lucas thinks he has seen a ghost when he comes face-to-face with Simon Lee, a young man who looks exactly like a Confederate officer he killed during the Civil War. Simon Lee is fast with a gun, and provokes Lucas into a life and death situation.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E22 Closer Than a Brother Marshal Micah Torrance loses his confidence in his job of authority and begins drinking again after an old enemy from the past terrorizes him. When Lucas learns of the situation, he invites the man to North Fork and convinces Micah to face his fears.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E10 Land Beyond the Law Cheyenne is on the run from the law for a crime that he did not commit in Lone Butte. To clear his name, he must infiltrate the Ellwood Gang to find the killer. His only clues are the killer's hideout and unusual belt buckle.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E11 Test of Courage A frustrated Army post commander court-martials Cheyenne for cowardice after he abandons a herd of needed Army horses. The commander wants answers and orders Cheyenne to take them to a desolate cavalry base used during enemy strikes.

programme.title: The Young Riders

programme.desc: S2 E10 Land Beyond the Law Cheyenne is on the run from the law for a crime that he did not commit in Lone Butte. To clear his name, he must infiltrate the Ellwood Gang to find the killer. His only clues are the killer's hideout and unusual belt buckle.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E11 Test of Courage A frustrated Army post commander court-martials Cheyenne for cowardice after he abandons a herd of needed Army horses. The commander wants answers and orders Cheyenne to take them to a desolate cavalry base used during enemy strikes.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E18 Matched Pair Jimmy reunites with Brad, an old friend and rival from his youth. They soon discover that Clara, the daughter of a man who was their mentor, is missing. In actuality, she ran away after finding out about her father's corruption.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E19 Man Behind the Badge Van Dorn, a corrupt businessman and the man responsible for the murder of Marshal Sam Cain's wife, comes to Sweetwater. First, he ousts Cain and takes over the town, and then he appoints his gang to be the law enforcement for the town.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E3 End of a Young Gun A young outlaw named Will Fulton saves Mark's life but breaks a leg in the process. He mends at Lucas' ranch, and there meets the lovely Ann Bard. The outlaw begins to soften and reassesses his choices and path in life.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E4 The Marshal Micah Torrance, formerly a famous marshal, who is now a drunk crippled from a gunfight, stumbles into North Fork. Lucas McCain hires him in hopes of rehabilitating the man. The good deed quickly backfires when outlaws arrive.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E1 They Killed Me Frontiersman Jim Bridger spins an incredible tale to a group of settlers, claiming he was once killed by Blackfeet warriors yet somehow lived to tell the tale. They think he's joking, but Bridger soon proves that he really did rise from the dead.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E4 Brothers in Arms When they are ambushed by a Blackfeet war party, Jim Bridger and a lone Shoshone brave must work together to find a way to defeat their common enemy. If they can't overcome their suspicions and learn to trust each other, they may not survive the day.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E10 Bat Masterson & the Dodge City Dead Line: Part 1 Legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson looks back on his time as sheriff of Dodge City when he and Wyatt Earp worked together to bring law and order to the notorious frontier town. As they struggle to pacify the rowdy cowhands passing through town, the two men draw their own proverbial “line in the sand.” South of the railroad track that splits the town, they let the cowboys run wild. But on the north side, they outlaw all guns in an effort to create a zone of civility. When a troublemaker crosses this “dead line” with his gun, it sets off a chain reaction of violence that endangers the town’s beloved entertainer, the celebrated singer Dora Hand.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E11 Bat Masterson & the Dodge City Dead Line: Part 2 Legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson looks back on his time as sheriff of Dodge City when he and Wyatt Earp worked together to bring law and order to the notorious frontier town. As they struggle to pacify the rowdy cowhands passing through town, the two men draw their own proverbial “line in the sand.” South of the railroad track that splits the town, they let the cowboys run wild. But on the north side, they outlaw all guns in an effort to create a zone of civility. When a troublemaker crosses this “dead line” with his gun, it sets off a chain reaction of violence that ends the life of the town’s beloved entertainer, the celebrated singer Dora Hand. After tracking down her killer, Masterson shoots him in the arm as he tries to escape. When the judge learns there are no witnesses, however, he sets the killer free due to lack of evidence, leaving Masterson with a moral dilemma. Does he seek revenge or await the s

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E6 Christopher Gist: Unsung Hero of the First Frontier After mapping the rugged Ohio Country, frontiersman and surveyor Christopher Gist accepts a new mission: lead a young George Washington to a remote French fort in the Ohio wilderness on a diplomatic journey which may change the course of history.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E19 Lessons Learned After his overturned conviction, a gunslinger named Randle seeks the men who testified against him and put him in jail. Meanwhile, Teaspoon's ex-wife, Polly, comes to Rock Creek to buy a saloon, but unfortunately becomes Randle's focus.

programme.title: Elkhorn
programme.desc: S1 E9 The Roundup Theodore Roosevelt and his Elkhorn men strike out for the open range to participate in their first cattle roundup. But their excitement about gathering their herd is soon overshadowed by the realization that others are conspiring against them.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E20 The Wyoming Story Part 1 After Lucas' herd is wiped out by disease, he takes a job as an undercover agent for the U.S. government to raise money for new cattle. He travels to Wyoming to learn how renegade Cheyenne Indians are getting rifles illegally.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E21 The Wyoming Story Part 2 Lucas continues his investigation in Wyoming and makes contact with the local Indian agent, the source of the illegal gun-running operation. However, Lucas' life is put in danger when the town drunk reveals his true identity.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E23 The Lost Treasure of Canyon Town On the way home to North Fork, Lucas, Micah, and Mark take a detour to Micah's hometown. A thriving mining town years ago, it is now a ghost town except for Mr. Newman and his son who still live there. Something is amiss, and a mystery is revealed.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E24 Dark Day at North Fork While hauling dynamite, Lucas accidentally creates a spark, leading to an explosion. He is blinded and Doc Burrage isn't sure if he will regain his sight. When an enemy from Lucas' past shows up in town, he is in danger, as the man aims to kill him.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E12 War Party While out on an Army mission, Cheyenne shoots a miner in self-defense. He stays to help the miner and his wife, but dangers loom when the Sioux arrive. Their sights are on the miner's wife and his gold.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E13 Deadline While Cheyenne works for Charley Dolan, he finds himself in the middle of a battle between Dolan and Len Garth, a gang leader who forces Dolan and others off their land. Garth soon burns the newspaper office, but Dolan aims to rebuild.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E18 Matched Pair Jimmy reunites with Brad, an old friend and rival from his youth. They soon discover that Clara, the daughter of a man who was their mentor, is missing. In actuality, she ran away after finding out about her father's corruption.

programme.title: The Young Riders

programme.desc: S1 E11 Bat Masterson & the Dodge City Dead Line: Part 2 Legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson looks back on his time as sheriff of Dodge City when he and Wyatt Earp worked together to bring law and order to the notorious frontier town. As they struggle to pacify the rowdy cowhands passing through town, the two men draw their own proverbial “line in the sand.” South of the railroad track that splits the town, they let the cowboys run wild. But on the north side, they outlaw all guns in an effort to create a zone of civility. When a troublemaker crosses this “dead line” with his gun, it sets off a chain reaction of violence that ends the life of the town’s beloved entertainer, the celebrated singer Dora Hand. After tracking down her killer, Masterson shoots him in the arm as he tries to escape. When the judge learns there are no witnesses, however, he sets the killer free due to lack of evidence, leaving Masterson with a moral dilemma. Does he seek revenge or await the s

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E6 Christopher Gist: Unsung Hero of the First Frontier After mapping the rugged Ohio Country, frontiersman and surveyor Christopher Gist accepts a new mission: lead a young George Washington to a remote French fort in the Ohio wilderness on a diplomatic journey which may change the course of history.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E19 Lessons Learned After his overturned conviction, a gunslinger named Randle seeks the men who testified against him and put him in jail. Meanwhile, Teaspoon's ex-wife, Polly, comes to Rock Creek to buy a saloon, but unfortunately becomes Randle's focus.

programme.title: Elkhorn
programme.desc: S1 E9 The Roundup Theodore Roosevelt and his Elkhorn men strike out for the open range to participate in their first cattle roundup. But their excitement about gathering their herd is soon overshadowed by the realization that others are conspiring against them.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E20 The Wyoming Story Part 1 After Lucas' herd is wiped out by disease, he takes a job as an undercover agent for the U.S. government to raise money for new cattle. He travels to Wyoming to learn how renegade Cheyenne Indians are getting rifles illegally.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E21 The Wyoming Story Part 2 Lucas continues his investigation in Wyoming and makes contact with the local Indian agent, the source of the illegal gun-running operation. However, Lucas' life is put in danger when the town drunk reveals his true identity.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E23 The Lost Treasure of Canyon Town On the way home to North Fork, Lucas, Micah, and Mark take a detour to Micah's hometown. A thriving mining town years ago, it is now a ghost town except for Mr. Newman and his son who still live there. Something is amiss, and a mystery is revealed.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E24 Dark Day at North Fork While hauling dynamite, Lucas accidentally creates a spark, leading to an explosion. He is blinded and Doc Burrage isn't sure if he will regain his sight. When an enemy from Lucas' past shows up in town, he is in danger, as the man aims to kill him.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E12 War Party While out on an Army mission, Cheyenne shoots a miner in self-defense. He stays to help the miner and his wife, but dangers loom when the Sioux arrive. Their sights are on the miner's wife and his gold.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E13 Deadline While Cheyenne works for Charley Dolan, he finds himself in the middle of a battle between Dolan and Len Garth, a gang leader who forces Dolan and others off their land. Garth soon burns the newspaper office, but Dolan aims to rebuild.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E20 Then There Was One Teaspoon travels to Texas with an old comrade to warn three aging veterans that someone has been murdering the last men who genuinely remember the Alamo. Jimmy and Buck follow from behind as Teaspoon tracks down the killer.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E2 Ghosts Rachel is troubled by a tragic incident from the past. The riders help clear her name after she was wrongfully charged with murder. Teaspoon finally finds out Lou's secret, but still allows her to continue as a rider.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E5 The Brother-In-Law Mark's uncle, Johnny Gibb, a famous rodeo rider, comes to visit. Mark idolizes his uncle, but Lucas soon discovers that Johnny is on the run from the law after robbing an express office, and is afraid that Johnny is a bad influence on young Mark.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E6 Eight Hours to Die Corrupt Judge Burton seeks justice against those who are responsible for the hanging of his son, including Lucas McCain, who caught him. When Burton discovers that Lucas has a son, he captures Lucas to make him watch Mark suffer the same punishment.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Spirit of Truth After his fur trapping expedition is surprised by a Crow war party, legendary mountain man Jim Bridger suddenly finds himself in a desperate struggle to rescue his fellow trappers when one of them goes missing, and another is on the brink of madness.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E3 The Fossil Feud When bloodthirsty Canadian trappers try to kill him, mountain man Jim Bridger takes cover in an unexplored valley. There, he runs headlong into a family of escaped slaves who show him the huge footprints and fossilized bones of long-dead monsters.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E12 The Hunt for Outlaw Bill Doolin When notorious outlaw Bill Doolin escapes from jail, the U.S. Marshals Service springs into action to end his four-year crime spree. Known as the “Three Guardsmen,” Deputy U.S. Marshals Heck Thomas, Bill Tilghman, and Chris Madsen have a reputation for always getting their man, but they know it won’t be easy with Doolin. Doolin is no ordinary outlaw: as a former member of The Dalton Gang and the mastermind of The Wild Bunch, he has successfully robbed banks, trains, and stagecoaches. After months of tracking Doolin, Heck Thomas is so close he barely stops to eat or sleep. When Thomas and his posse finally corner Doolin, he refuses to surrender, and gunfire is the only way out. Some years later, Bat Masterson, former-gunfighter-turned-newspaperman, catches up with Bill Tilghman to hear the real story behind the hunt for the outlaw Bill Doolin.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S1 E15 Charles M. Russell: The Cowboy Artist Charlie Russell is an aimless cowhand who loves the freedom of the cowboy way of life, and he is a self-taught artist who enjoys capturing the scenes of his rugged work on the range. Too embarrassed to ask people to pay for his paintings, he gives most of them away to friends or trades them for drinks at the saloon. But that changes quickly after he falls in love. Charlie’s new bride Nancy gives him the encouragement he needs to stop cowboying in order to focus on his artwork. Under her watchful eye, he sobers up, stops cowboying, and improves his mastery of painting. Nancy is so proud of Charlie’s talent that she doesn’t hesitate to ask top dollar for his paintings. Years later, when legendary gunfighter-turned-newspaperman Bat Masterson tries to do a piece on Charlie, he quickly realizes that he must first deal with the woman behind the famous cowboy artist Charles M. Russell.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E1 Anne Bailey: Horseback Heroine After Anne Bailey's husband is killed by Native Americans, she defies the social norms of the frontier and becomes a horseback courier, risking her life to race through hostile territory delivering vital supplies to isolated forts and settlements.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E20 The Debt A new rider named Matt trains to replace Lou when she gets married. However, when the new rider disappears on his first ride, Jimmy and Lou go after him. Jimmy soon discovers that the Garrett brothers are responsible for Matt's demise.

programme.title: Elkhorn
programme.desc: S1 E10 A Man for All Seasons When a lightning strike spooks the herd, an injured Theodore Roosevelt acts quickly to stop a stampede during the fall roundup. As he makes plans to return to New York for winter, tensions between old enemies finally come to an explosive head.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E25 The Prisoner When two ex-Confederate officers come to town, trouble ensues for Lucas as he was a lieutenant in the 8th Indiana which defeated the 12th Cavalry 15 years ago. The beaten men were sent to a Union prison camp and now want revenge on Lucas.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E26 Assault Traveling salesman Speed Sullivan, and his son, Swifty, come to North Fork selling lightning rods. Sullivan makes a call at Vashti Croxton's home where he finds her unconscious. When she blames Sullivan for the assault, Lucas must intervene.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E27 Short Rope for a Tall Man Lucas and Mark travel to a nearby town to sell a bull. While in town, they buy two horses from Mr. Schneider, a man in a hurry. When a posse stops Lucas and Mark on the way home, Lucas learns the horses were stolen. The men want Lucas to hang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E28 The Clarence Bibs Story Clarence Bibs, a simple-minded man, fancies himself as a gunfighter. While practicing, he falls and his gun fires, killing a famous gunslinger. The man's partner comes to town wanting revenge.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E14 Big Ghost Basin Cheyenne finds a dead man's body and strange signs from the mysterious killer on a trail to Crowheart. When he arrives in town with the body, the townspeople suspect him to be a member of the rustler gang that's responsible.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E15 Born Bad Cheyenne follows a thief and killer into a small town where the killer's father is the sheriff. After the sheriff resigns, Cheyenne takes the job. Problems arise when he falls for a girl who is the sister of the killer and daughter of the sheriff.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E20 Then There Was One Teaspoon travels to Texas with an old comrade to warn three aging veterans that someone has been murdering the last men who genuinely remember the Alamo. Jimmy and Buck follow from behind as Teaspoon tracks down the killer.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S2 E2 Ghosts Rachel is troubled by a tragic incident from the past. The riders help clear her name after she was wrongfully charged with murder. Teaspoon finally finds out Lou's secret, but still allows her to continue as a rider.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E5 The Brother-In-Law Mark's uncle, Johnny Gibb, a famous rodeo rider, comes to visit. Mark idolizes his uncle, but Lucas soon discovers that Johnny is on the run from the law after robbing an express office, and is afraid that Johnny is a bad influence on young Mark.

programme.desc: S3 E28 The Clarence Bibs Story Clarence Bibs, a simple-minded man, fancies himself as a gunfighter. While practicing, he falls and his gun fires, killing a famous gunslinger. The man's partner comes to town wanting revenge.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E14 Big Ghost Basin Cheyenne finds a dead man's body and strange signs from the mysterious killer on a trail to Crowheart. When he arrives in town with the body, the townspeople suspect him to be a member of the rustler gang that's responsible.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E15 Born Bad Cheyenne follows a thief and killer into a small town where the killer's father is the sheriff. After the sheriff resigns, Cheyenne takes the job. Problems arise when he falls for a girl who is the sister of the killer and daughter of the sheriff.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E21 Gathering Clouds Part 1 As tensions rise between the North and the South, the Army recruits the Kid to infiltrate a band of Southern rebel guerrillas led by a man known as the Hawk.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E22 Gathering Clouds Part 2 Jimmy joins the Kid in infiltrating the Hawk's gang. Meanwhile, as the Civil War nears, Sweetwater becomes an embattled town as townspeople must take up arms against the renegades.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E7 Duel of Honor Italian Count Alfredo Di Montova comes to North Fork. His unique clothing attracts the attention of town bully Sim Groder. When Groder pushes the count too far, Montova initiates a duel, and asks Lucas to assist with the rules.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Safe Guard A new bank opens in North Fork, and banker John Hamilton hires Floyd Doniger for security. However, problems arise when robbers who followed the new safe into town discover their old pal Floyd is the bank guard.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E6 Fool's Gold After discovering a river filled with gold, Jim Bridger and his fellow trappers believe they are near El Dorado, the mythical Spanish city of gold. But their insatiable greed turns friends into enemies and puts Bridger at risk of a gruesome fate.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E5 A Prince on the Prairie While guiding a hunting expedition, Jim Bridger must deal with an arrogant foreign prince who is abusing his servant boy. But the tables soon turn, when it's the prince who needs rescuing, and his only hope is the long-suffering servant boy.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E5 The Masterson Brothers Part 1 After Marshal Ed Masterson is shot while breaking up a barroom brawl, he hastily bans all firearms in Dodge City. Ed's swift proclamation is met with disdain by most townsfolk, including his own brothers, and places an even larger target on his back.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E6 The Masterson Brothers Part 2 After Marshal Ed Masterson is gunned down in Dodge City, his youngest brother, James, decides to follow in his footsteps and become a lawman. But when James' life is threatened, middle brother Bat Masterson races back from Arizona to protect his kin.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E7 George Croghan: Frontier Peacemaker When Chief Pontiac organizes a coalition of Native American tribes to attack British forts, frontier trader George Croghan risks his life on a perilous journey into the wilderness to find Pontiac, negotiate a peace agreement, and prevent all-out war.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E21 'Til Death Do Us Part Part 1 The Kid and Lou's special day is approaching, and the riders prepare for the couple's upcoming wedding. Teaspoon is upset over when the Army arrives in Rock Creek to recruit young men as scouts. Meanwhile, the townspeople brace for the Civil War.

programme.title: Elkhorn
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Greenhorn After suffering a great personal loss, 25-year-old Theodore Roosevelt abandons New York for the lawless Dakota Badlands. Along the way, he faces doubters and killers as he attempts to establish the Elkhorn Ranch and remake himself into a cattleman.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E29 The Score Is Even Lucas and Mark go on a hunting trip and soon become witnesses to a robbery and murder. Lucas subdues the two robbers, but is severely wounded in the process. Lucas struggles to get the robbers to justice, but devises a plan just in the nick of time.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E30 The Mescalero Curse Lucas serves as a jury foreman when a Mescalero Apache Indian is found guilty of murder and is hanged. A Mescalero medicine man places a curse on Lucas. At first Lucas brushes it off, then unusual events begin to happen including a ghost stallion.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E31 Stopover A brutal snowstorm makes the roads impassable and forces a stagecoach to stop at the McCain Ranch. Lucas gives the passengers shelter, but little does he know a dance hall girl, a drunk, and a famous gunslinger are his guests.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E32 The Lonesome Bride Brothers Charv and Kelly Banner play a joke on Lucas that soon gets out of hand when they contact a St. Louis marriage bureau to send a possible bride for Lucas. Mary Woodson arrives in North Fork ready for marriage, but Lucas wants no part of it.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E16 The Brand While looking for his missing friend, Cheyenne tries to help a troubled young man responsible for caring for his younger siblings. He soon finds out that the man has committed a serious crime that is unfortunately associated with his missing friend.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E17 Decision at Gunsight In repayment for a debt owed him, Cheyenne receives the deed worth $3000 to a livery stable in Gunsight. However, Cheyenne discovers the truth when he learns of weekly payment to the Gerrard Gang is part of the deal.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E21 Gathering Clouds Part 1 As tensions rise between the North and the South, the Army recruits the Kid to infiltrate a band of Southern rebel guerrillas led by a man known as the Hawk.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S1 E22 Gathering Clouds Part 2 Jimmy joins the Kid in infiltrating the Hawk's gang. Meanwhile, as the Civil War nears, Sweetwater becomes an embattled town as townspeople must take up arms against the renegades.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E7 Duel of Honor Italian Count Alfredo Di Montova comes to North Fork. His unique clothing attracts the attention of town bully Sim Groder. When Groder pushes the count too far, Montova initiates a duel, and asks Lucas to assist with the rules.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S1 E8 The Safe Guard A new bank opens in North Fork, and banker John Hamilton hires Floyd Doniger for security. However, problems arise when robbers who followed the new safe into town discover their old pal Floyd is the bank guard.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E6 Fool's Gold After discovering a river filled with gold, Jim Bridger and his fellow trappers believe they are near El Dorado, the mythical Spanish city of gold. But their insatiable greed turns friends into enemies and puts Bridger at risk of a gruesome fate.

programme.title: The Tall Tales of Jim Bridger
programme.desc: S1 E5 A Prince on the Prairie While guiding a hunting expedition, Jim Bridger must deal with an arrogant foreign prince who is abusing his servant boy. But the tables soon turn, when it's the prince who needs rescuing, and his only hope is the long-suffering servant boy.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E5 The Masterson Brothers Part 1 After Marshal Ed Masterson is shot while breaking up a barroom brawl, he hastily bans all firearms in Dodge City. Ed's swift proclamation is met with disdain by most townsfolk, including his own brothers, and places an even larger target on his back.

programme.title: Wild West Chronicles
programme.desc: S2 E6 The Masterson Brothers Part 2 After Marshal Ed Masterson is gunned down in Dodge City, his youngest brother, James, decides to follow in his footsteps and become a lawman. But when James' life is threatened, middle brother Bat Masterson races back from Arizona to protect his kin.

programme.title: Into The Wild Frontier
programme.desc: S3 E7 George Croghan: Frontier Peacemaker When Chief Pontiac organizes a coalition of Native American tribes to attack British forts, frontier trader George Croghan risks his life on a perilous journey into the wilderness to find Pontiac, negotiate a peace agreement, and prevent all-out war.

programme.title: The Young Riders
programme.desc: S3 E21 'Til Death Do Us Part Part 1 The Kid and Lou's special day is approaching, and the riders prepare for the couple's upcoming wedding. Teaspoon is upset over when the Army arrives in Rock Creek to recruit young men as scouts. Meanwhile, the townspeople brace for the Civil War.

programme.title: Elkhorn
programme.desc: S1 E1 The Greenhorn After suffering a great personal loss, 25-year-old Theodore Roosevelt abandons New York for the lawless Dakota Badlands. Along the way, he faces doubters and killers as he attempts to establish the Elkhorn Ranch and remake himself into a cattleman.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E29 The Score Is Even Lucas and Mark go on a hunting trip and soon become witnesses to a robbery and murder. Lucas subdues the two robbers, but is severely wounded in the process. Lucas struggles to get the robbers to justice, but devises a plan just in the nick of time.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E30 The Mescalero Curse Lucas serves as a jury foreman when a Mescalero Apache Indian is found guilty of murder and is hanged. A Mescalero medicine man places a curse on Lucas. At first Lucas brushes it off, then unusual events begin to happen including a ghost stallion.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E31 Stopover A brutal snowstorm makes the roads impassable and forces a stagecoach to stop at the McCain Ranch. Lucas gives the passengers shelter, but little does he know a dance hall girl, a drunk, and a famous gunslinger are his guests.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: S3 E32 The Lonesome Bride Brothers Charv and Kelly Banner play a joke on Lucas that soon gets out of hand when they contact a St. Louis marriage bureau to send a possible bride for Lucas. Mary Woodson arrives in North Fork ready for marriage, but Lucas wants no part of it.

programme.title: Cheyenne
programme.desc: S2 E16 The Brand While looking for his missing friend, Cheyenne tries to help a troubled young man responsible for caring for his younger siblings. He soon finds out that the man has committed a serious crime that is unfortunately associated with his missing friend.

programme.title: Cheyenne

programme.title: Chain Reaction

programme.title: Chain Reaction
programme.desc: Two teams of three compete to complete a chain of words after the first and last words in the chain are revealed. The team that completes the most chains wins and advances to a bonus round to determine the amount of money won. Dylan Lane hosts.

programme.title: Catch 21

programme.title: Catch 21
programme.desc: Players must combine their trivia talent with card-counting skills to win at "Catch 21." Alfonso Ribiero hosts.

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: Cash Cab
programme.desc: In this offbeat game show, players picked up in the Cash Cab have to answer trivia questions with mounting cash values before they reach their destination in order to win. If a player answers incorrectly three times, he is kicked out of the cab without any money. Help options include a Mobile Shout-Out (phone call) and Street Shout-Out (asking a stranger on the street). Once the player reaches his destination, he can leave the cab with his winnings, if any, or risk them on a more difficult question. A correct final answer doubles his winnings; an incorrect answer means he leaves the cab with no money at all. Comic Ben Bailey takes the cab's wheel as host.

programme.title: The $100,000 Pyramid
programme.desc: Two teams of two compete in a word-association game. Each contestant gets a celebrity partner, and one partner provides clues to the other about six mystery words, leaving the other to guess those words before the time runs out. The team with the most points gets to play in the winners circle, where the top prize is $100,000. Michael Strahan hosts.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire
programme.desc: Contestants answer increasingly difficult multiple-choice questions to win cash - up to $1 million, or even more in certain episodes. Along the way, contestants have "lifelines" they can use to help them answer the questions, including asking the studio audience for help.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash from one penny to $1 million. The player then eliminates the remaining 25 cases one by one. The chosen ones are opened and the amount of money inside revealed. After several cases are opened, the player is tempted by the Banker to accept an offer of cash in exchange for not continuing the game and possibly winning a larger sum of money.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Jeopardy!
programme.desc: "Jeopardy!" is a classic game show - with a twist. The answers are given first, and the contestants supply the questions. Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot - as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek is the current host; he began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run).

programme.title: Master Minds
programme.desc: Three challengers take on some of the great minds in trivia in a showdown of smarts and strategy; the last contestant standing will face off against the highest scoring Master Mind in a head-to-head battle.

programme.title: America Says
programme.desc: Game show series have been making a comeback in television, and media and "America Says" is no exception. This program is following in the footsteps of the popular mobile app game "HQ Trivia." The network is planning its own spin on the game show, and Fran Shea, evp, programming and marketing, says she "has been studying the GSN audience and prepared a slate of new shows that reflect what it wants: family-friendly, fun, escapist television." In "America Says," two teams face off to guess Americans' responses to questions covering a variety of topics. Michael Higgins is the host.

programme.title: America Says
programme.desc: Game show series have been making a comeback in television, and media and "America Says" is no exception. This program is following in the footsteps of the popular mobile app game "HQ Trivia." The network is planning its own spin on the game show, and Fran Shea, evp, programming and marketing, says she "has been studying the GSN audience and prepared a slate of new shows that reflect what it wants: family-friendly, fun, escapist television." In "America Says," two teams face off to guess Americans' responses to questions covering a variety of topics. Michael Higgins is the host.

programme.title: Switch
programme.desc: Jeff Hephner challenges contestants who are ranked based on their answers to trivia questions for a chance at $10,000; every question counts, as each answer can propel them to the top or to the bottom, where they'll be in jeopardy of elimination.

programme.title: Split Second
programme.desc: John Michael Higgins presents three contestants with a question and three possible choices and whoever buzzes in fastest earns the right to answer first.

programme.title: Flip Side
programme.desc: The hilarious new survey game show explores answers to questions from differing perspectives; host Jaleel White.

programme.title: Chain Reaction
programme.desc: This incarnation of the word-association game show that dates back, in various forms, to the early '80s is hosted by radio personality Mike Catherwood ("Loveline"). The premise is simple: two teams try to complete chains of seven words. The first and last word in each chain are revealed, and the contestants must guess the missing words, with one letter being revealed each turn. Each link in the chain forms a compound word or phrase with the word before and/or after it. Teams earn money for each word they guess correctly, and the team with the most money at the end of the game goes on to the bonus round, dubbed the Super Chain, for a chance to add an additional $5,000 to the total the team won during the main part of the game.

programme.title: Beat the Bridge
programme.desc: An interactive bridge dares players to cross by stepping on the right answers to challenging trivia questions; each step forward puts money in the team's bank, with bonus money for each successful crossing.

programme.title: Split Second
programme.desc: John Michael Higgins presents three contestants with a question and three possible choices and whoever buzzes in fastest earns the right to answer first.

programme.title: The Wall
programme.desc: Everyday people battle a variety of trivia questions and a 40-foot wall for a chance to win millions of dollars. Each pair of deserving contestants, from siblings to spouses to best friends, has a plan to use the life-changing winnings for good things. But defeating the wall is no easy feat. Executive Producer LeBron James' game is a true test of both knowledge and poise. With momentary changes between fortune and failure, the outcome is as unpredictable as the bounce of the ball.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

Three contestants, including the previous show's champion, compete in six categories and in three rounds (with each round's "answers" being worth more prize money). In the third round, "Final Jeopardy," the contestants can name their own jackpot - as long as it's within the amount of money they've already earned. If a player finishes the second round with zero dollars, they are eliminated from "Final Jeopardy." The first version of "Jeopardy!," which aired from 1964 to 1975 on NBC, was hosted by Art Fleming. Alex Trebek is the current host; he began with the program in 1984 (at the start of its syndicated run).

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Flip Side
programme.desc: The hilarious new survey game show explores answers to questions from differing perspectives; host Jaleel White.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Contestants guess hidden phrases by guessing letters one at a time. Contestants win money or prizes, as determined by a spin of the wheel, for each correct consonant they guess. But they have to pay to see what vowels are in a puzzle. The contestant that has amassed the most winnings at the end of a game goes on to play the bonus round, in which the player can win even more - prizes frequently seen in the bonus round include automobiles, vacations and more cash.

programme.title: People Puzzler
programme.desc: Leah Remini hosts the show, which features three contestants who put their pop culture knowledge to the test to complete crosswords from the pop culture magazine. During a player's turn, one word out of 10 is chosen from the board. The contestant is then shown the first unrevealed letter in the word, and a clue is given, with correct answers scoring points based on the word. The player who wins the most points after three rounds moves forward to the fast puzzle bonus round, where they get the opportunity to win a cash prize.

programme.title: Match Game
programme.desc: Gene Rayburn hosts this comedy-game show hybrid in which contestants try to match answers given by celebrities to humorous, and often risque, fill-in-the-blank questions. The contestant with the most points at the end of the game advances to play the bonus round, in which the contestant has a chance to win thousands of dollars, with the actual amount dependent on the rules in place at the time of the episode.
